actor_awards.notes: A master of the double-take and the jittery comic persona, he appeared in many Astaire-Rogers musicals and Lubitsch comedies. He was also the narrator of the 'Fractured Fairy Tales' segment on 'The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show'.

filmography.title: Top Hat
filmography.role_description: The bumbling producer friend of Jerry Travers who gets caught up in a case of mistaken identity.
filmography.plot: An American dancer comes to London and falls for a model who mistakes him for his goofy producer.

filmography.title: The Gay Divorcee
filmography.role_description: An incompetent lawyer who arranges a fake adultery scene for a client, leading to romantic complications.
filmography.plot: A woman thinks a flirting man is the co-respondent her lawyer has hired to expedite her divorce.

filmography.title: Trouble in Paradise
filmography.role_description: A wealthy suitor who was previously robbed by the protagonist and tries to remember where they met.
filmography.plot: A gentleman thief and a lady pickpocket join forces to con a beautiful perfume company owner.

filmography.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
filmography.role_description: The superintendent of the Happy Dale Sanitarium who unwittingly becomes a potential victim.
filmography.plot: A drama critic learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are homicidal maniacs.

filmography.title: Holiday
filmography.role_description: The eccentric, fun-loving friend of the protagonist who supports his desire for a holiday from work.
filmography.plot: A young man woos a wealthy girl but finds he has more in common with her unconventional sister.

filmography.title: Lost Horizon
filmography.role_description: A fussy, fossil-hunting paleontologist who is one of the passengers hijacked to Shangri-La.
filmography.plot: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La, but is it the utopia it appears to be?
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Film Editing

filmography.title: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
filmography.role_description: An officious heavenly messenger who mistakenly takes a boxer's soul before his time.
filmography.plot: A boxer, mistakenly taken to Heaven before his time, is given a second chance back on Earth.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Story, Best Screenplay

filmography.title: The Front Page
filmography.role_description: A poetic, germ-phobic reporter who gets caught up in the media circus surrounding an execution.
filmography.plot: A reporter tries to quit his job to marry, but his editor tricks him into covering one last big story.

filmography.title: Shall We Dance
filmography.role_description: The bumbling manager of a ballet dancer who tries to keep his client out of trouble.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer and a tap dancer fake a marriage for publicity, then fall in love.

filmography.title: Design for Living
filmography.role_description: A stuffy advertising executive who marries a free-spirited woman, only to have her former lovers return.
filmography.plot: A woman cannot decide between two men who love her, so they try a three-way platonic relationship.

filmography.title: The Merry Widow
filmography.role_description: The flustered ambassador who tries to ensure a wealthy widow marries a countryman to save the national economy.
filmography.plot: A prince courts a wealthy widow to keep her money in the kingdom.

filmography.title: Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic suitor who is rejected by the heroine in favor of a wealthy American.
filmography.plot: A wealthy man marries his eighth wife, who is determined not to be treated like the previous seven.

filmography.title: Angel
filmography.role_description: The valet to an English diplomat who knows more than he lets on.
filmography.plot: A diplomat's wife has a fling with a stranger in Paris, who turns out to be her husband's wartime friend.

filmography.title: Pocketful of Miracles
filmography.role_description: The impeccable butler to a gangster who helps transform a street peddler into a society lady.
filmography.plot: A gangster helps an old apple-seller pose as a wealthy society matron to impress her daughter.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Costume Design, Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
filmography.role_description: The elderly owner of a hardware store who gets locked in his own basement.
filmography.plot: A group of strangers fighting over a buried fortune in a chaotic cross-country race.

filmography.title: The Gang's All Here
filmography.role_description: A stuffy businessman who tries to keep his family in line amidst a wild musical revue.
filmography.plot: A soldier falls for a showgirl, but he's already engaged to a rich girl whose father is a business partner.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: The eccentric tea-party host in this star-studded Paramount adaptation.
filmography.plot: Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar anthropomorphic creatures.

filmography.title: Summer Storm
filmography.role_description: A hedonistic Russian aristocrat caught up in a tragic love triangle.
filmography.plot: An aristocratic judge falls for a beautiful peasant girl, leading to ruin and murder in pre-revolutionary Russia.

filmography.title: Lady on a Train
filmography.role_description: A business manager who becomes a suspect in a murder witnessed from a train window.
filmography.plot: A woman witnesses a murder from a train and enlists a mystery writer to help her solve it.

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Girl
filmography.role_description: An auditioning judge who interacts with the aspiring showgirls.
filmography.plot: Three women try to find fame and fortune by joining the Ziegfeld Follies.

filmography.title: Springtime in the Rockies
filmography.role_description: The valet to the main character, providing comic relief in this Technicolor musical.
filmography.plot: A Broadway show's partners have a falling out, leading to a romantic pursuit at a Canadian resort.

filmography.title: San Diego I Love You
filmography.role_description: An eccentric schoolteacher and inventor who tries to sell a collapsible life raft.
filmography.plot: A family travels to San Diego to sell the father's invention, getting involved in various misadventures.

filmography.title: Hitting a New High
filmography.role_description: A wealthy opera patron who is tricked by a singer posing as a jungle girl.
filmography.plot: An opera singer tries to get discovered by posing as a 'bird-girl' in Africa.

filmography.title: Brazil
filmography.role_description: A writer who visits Brazil to research a book and gets entangled in a romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: The author of a book critical of Brazil visits the country and falls for a local woman.

filmography.title: Cold Turkey
filmography.role_description: A mute, wheelchair-bound tobacco tycoon. Horton's final film role.
filmography.plot: A tobacco company offers $25 million to any town that can stop smoking for 30 days.
